taskGroup.name: First FeatureIDE with WinVMJ Project
taskGroup.intro:
Welcome to the WinVMJ Composer Plugin Tutorial.
This tutorial will guide you through building your first WinVMJ project within FeatureIDE. By the end of this tutorial, you will have created a basic software product line using WinVMJ, utilizing the Delta-Oriented Programming approach for Software Product Line Engineering (SPLE). If you encounter any issues during the steps, you can refer to the final result available through File -> New -> Example in the Eclipse main menu.
The first phase in setting up your product line is domain engineering. In this phase, you'll define which features your product line will include and how they will interact. WinVMJ leverages FeatureIDE's capabilities to facilitate modular and flexible product line development, incorporating feature models and delta modules.
More Information: To learn more about Delta-Oriented Programming and SPLE, visit the WinVMJ-AISCO GitLab Repository. This tutorial will also introduce you to key concepts and tools, such as configuring projects, defining features, and generating product variations.
Let's get started!
taskGroup.onCompletion: Great! You have completed the tutorial!

task.name: Creating a FeatureIDE project
task.intro: This tutorial guides you through the creation of FeatureIDE project using WinVMJ composer.
task.onCompletion: You have created your first FeatureIDE project.

task.name: Creating a feature model
task.intro: This tutorial guides you through the creation a feature model.
task.onCompletion: You have created your first feature model.

taskGroup.name: Implementing features
taskGroup.intro: <description> Choose a composer and implement the features. </description>

task.name: WinVMJ
task.intro: This tutorial guides you through the implementation of features using WinVMJ
task.onCompletion: You have implemented your first FeatureIDE project using WinVMJ
